abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Education and
            Training Support Project for Cote d'Ivoire are to
            assist the borrower to resume the delivery of education
            services in primary schools, which implies: (i) providing
            quality school inputs to guarantee teaching and learning in
            classrooms, and (ii) improving access to education and
            retention of primary school children. The closing date for
            the project will be extended from August 31, 2011 until
            August 31, 2012. The original credit was in the amount of
            US$53.3 million and approved on May 29, 1998. The purpose of
            this extension request is to: (i) allow for the completion
            of contracts that have already been entered into but have
            not been completed due to delays resulting from the
            political situation in the country; (ii) provide much needed
            education inputs in the post crisis environment; and (iii)
            complete ongoing activities necessary to achieve the Project
            Development Objectives (PDO). The extension of the closing
            date will also support progress toward meeting the
            Heavily-Indebted Poor Country (HIPC) completion point
            related to textbooks, namely that '90 percent of the
            students enrolled in all public primary schools have
            received three textbooks covering French, mathematics, and
            civic education, during at least the school year immediately
            preceding the completion point'. The government had
            purchased textbooks covering French, mathematics and civic
            education which it intends to distribute for free to
            students enrolled in public primary schools. This will be
            the fifth and final extension and will result in a
            cumulative extension of nine years and eight months from the
            project's original closing date, requiring Regional
            Vice President Approval.
